note.p: Research Field: Physical astronomy, spectroscopy, photography

Career: Teacher, Lycee Charlemagne, Paris (1853); travelled to Peru to determine the magnetic equator (1857); Teacher, School of Archictecture, Paris (1865-1871); made magnetic observations in the Azores (1867) and at Oran, Algeria (1882); observed solar eclipses in Algiers, for which he escaped from Paris in a hot air balloon (1870), Siam (1875), Caroline Islands (1883) and Spain (1905); Director, Astrophysical Observatory established by the French government, Meudon (1875)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1908 vol 81 pp lxxvii-lxxxi signed by N L
